{"step_by_step_thinking": "The artery palpable at the anterior border of the masseter is mentioned in Document [17] and [19]. According to Document [17], the pulse of the facial artery can be palpated at the anteroinferior angle of the masseter muscle against the bony surface of the mandible. Document [19] also states that the masseter muscle primarily gets its vascular supply from the masseteric artery, a branch of the maxillary artery. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Facial artery.", "answer_choice": "B"}
